meanings.definition: To place or set in a new position
meanings.sent1: She resited the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The workers resited the sign to make it more visible.
meanings.sent3: The cat resited the toy mouse in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The sun resited itself behind the clouds.
meanings.sent5: He resited the book on the top shelf out of reach.

meanings.definition: To relocate or move to a different location
meanings.sent1: They resited the picnic to the park.
meanings.sent2: The family resited to a new house across town.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel resited its acorns to a safer spot.
meanings.sent4: The music resited from the living room to the backyard.
meanings.sent5: She resited her chair closer to the fireplace for warmth.

meanings.definition: To establish or build again in a different place
meanings.sent1: The city resited the playground to a more central location.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, they resited the tent on higher ground.
meanings.sent3: The chef resited his restaurant in a bus for a unique dining experience.
meanings.sent4: The artist resited her studio to a loft with better lighting.
meanings.sent5: He resited the bird feeder to attract more colorful birds.
